question: Which state launched the 'Free Surgery Scheme' like heart by-pass, kidney stone surgery and laparoscopic gall bladder surgery?
explanation: Delhi's Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal announced a new health scheme to enable capital's residents avail free surgery in private hospitals at government's cost. This would be applicable in case government hospitals were unable to operate within one month. The facility is available for 52 types of specified surgeries like heart by-pass, kidney stone surgery and laparoscopic gall bladder surgery. It will be taken care of at 48 NABH-accredited private hospitals in Delhi-NCR. These include Moolchand Hospital, Rockland Hospital and Batra Hospital in south Delhi.
